column4: I have been trying to figure out why my laptop (Kubuntu) will not shut down properly if I use the GUI or "sudo shutdown now" at CLI.  I have pasted my syslog from the time I tried to turn off my computer http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/16503/ if someone wouldn't mind assisting me.
why does it matter?
I do not like to have to press the power key until it powers off.
: do you power off by pulling the plug on your computer?
no, but you can hold the power button to shut it off nicely
normally yes, but not now for some reason. The system seems to hang, hence the paste of my syslog as I don't unerstand much of it...
my computer screen goes blank and the fan is running but the HD led is not doing anything. I left it this way for over 20 miutes with no change.
shutting off the computer, i believe is done through acpi, which is notoriously buggy since it tends to vary between hardware so much...unfortunately that means shutdown is hard, reset is easy
you probably just have to wait until it gets fixed, unless you're experienced with the kernel, then you might be able to hack it yourself -- but even then it'd be hard
so what do I do? IT has been working fine for long time until I installed the AIT drivers
Not experienced
BTW still using 7.04
in that case its probably to do with your hdd driver, you might be best off reporting a bug
Could it be possible that it has to do with the installing of ATI proprietary drivers?  The first 2 lines of my syslog right at the time I try to shutdown deal with fglrx and an error...
That is the only thing that stands out in http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/16503/
it probably is because of the proprietary drivers -- if you can survive without them, revert your changes otherwise report a bug is what i'd do
How do I uninstall the AIT drivers?
I tried going through the install for the drivers provided by ubuntu as per how-to,
Not sure which ones Im using anymore
Hmmm... that might be an issue, i don't happen to know those drivers, but usually the install process can be followed in reverse if you find the right parameters
and the forums are down at the moment
: I found the fglrx-uninstall.sh in /usr/share/ati
